website_summaries.verdict: Choose this inexpensive, basic model if you prefer a minimalist range hood and don't mind the possibility of a few potentially frustrating quirks.
pros: A good option for customized kitchens, as it can be positioned flush under cabinetry
Earns praise for its effective suction
cons: Installing it yourself requires quite a bit of wiring know-how
Some units came with missing parts and/or without instructions

customer_reviews.title: 2 years after the install, I'm really pleased with this unit
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit (390) with a matching hood 2 years ago for an install in our new home. The installation was done professionally, so i cannot speak about it's ease or difficulty. I can say that the unit has performed extremely well. I installed LED bulbs so they should last for many years. lighting coverage is very good. The fan is powerful and easily draws cooking odors out of the kitchen. I've seen complaints about the noise when the fan is on high. You can certainly hear it blowing, but it's on high. I kind of expected it to make some noise at that setting. it's certainly not bothersome. I would gladly buy this unit again.
customer_reviews.author: david e

customer_reviews.title: Great set up and $$--for a custom hood you build
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install for average diy'er w some carpentry skills. Fan on high is loud, but takes care of fumes quickly so you don't need it on for long. Not yet sure it does much on low...but that is very quiet. Great light...one setting for 2 bulbs. Two are always on. Bulbs are pricey compared to previous ones...and you won't find them at Walmart. Overall we are pleased. The cost of this set up beats the box stores by a lot. I'd buy it again...its great to customize how you want your hood to look...kind of priceless when you get to control its appearance.
customer_reviews.author: MM of ME

customer_reviews.title: I could not be happier with the vent
customer_reviews.text: I researched in-cabinet vent hoods until my eyes were bleeding. I had to install this in a galley kitchen that had a slim cabinet, so the footprint was critical. I was hesitant to buy this because it was far and away the cheapest of the options I found. I could not be happier with the vent. It installed cleanly, looks custom, and moves an impressive amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson11285

customer_reviews.title: Worked out fine. Had a copper case made around it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out fine. Had a copper case made around it and it's a great range hood. One of a kind
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Urban

customer_reviews.title: Need help with install unless you are really handy.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had ordered this product a long time ago. It will work as a non vented hood. We had this fake hood and it worked perfect. I do order the other piece that goes under the hood and this exhaust hood snaps in it. I also hired a handyman. It looks great and not too noisy.
customer_reviews.author: kimmi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought a fixer upped and wanted to open up the floor plan by removing the wall separating the kitchen from the living room. I built an island with a stove top and realized that if I got a bulky vent it would ruin the open layout. Decided to buy this and it is absolutely perfect. It’s small but is just as strong as any other vent. Will try to post pictures. Will be buying another one for a tiny house I’m building next.
customer_reviews.author: Demetria Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I needed a hood insert for a custom hood I was building and this didn't disappoint. If I have a complaint it would be the plastic switches and I wish it cost less based on what you are getting. It's just the power pack. Still, totally satisfied, it has plenty of power for a 15' run with 6" duct, and the sound level was good. On low it's hardly discernable, and on medium not bad at all. On high it does get a little loud but I don't intend on using that setting very often. It was all within my expectations. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No plug in!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is not as loud as others have stated in comparison to the vent in my microwave. While in low mode it’s pretty quiet but On high mode it picks up a notch which isn’t too bad. My only complaint is that this has to be wired. It does not come with a plug in cord. Maybe I misread the description, but my handyman had to go to Lowe’s to rewire it into a plug in form. Which has now taken more time to install and obviously more out of pocket on my end. He said “that’s what happens when you order off of Amazon”.
customer_reviews.author: LVG

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS BROAN FAN
customer_reviews.text: Once this fan was installed and we turned it on to test, the light bulb blew up and blew the circuit breaker. We thought it was a faulty bulb so we installed two more new bulbs, the light fixture does not work at all. There was no electrical issue because the fan works without issue. The contractor who was renovating my kitchen did not get to install the fan until two weeks after my return date. Now Broan and/or Amazon will not do anything because the fan was installed. I am a very good Amazon Prime customer who will now look to do business with others because of this experience and their lack of commitment to its customers.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B

customer_reviews.title: Turned out great/ pairs nicely with hood liner (Broan LB30)
customer_reviews.text: Bought in conjunction with the Broan LB30 hood liner - overall I am pleased with the way these work! Fan on high is a little loud but packs a lot of power. For the price, you really can’t beat this unit! I had to improvise a bit with how the vent connects to the hood due to how I built around it- very east to add a few screws from the bottom (as opposed to the side which is how it comes). Other than the screw placement requiring modification, the unit works well, Dan has great power- can’t complain!
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this thing is quiet and can move some air. Just note that any fan over 400 CFM needs to be connected to your HVAC by code. This one coming in at 390 is perfect and doesn't require expensive modifications. Fits great in our Omega hood.
customer_reviews.author: Mike J

customer_reviews.title: low speed is perfect, BUT
customer_reviews.text: the higher speed is a little noisy. I replaced my old model that the fan broke apart after about 12 years with this one. It is the exact same model, but the higher speed is a little noisy. It could be better. If there was a more expensive model with less noise, I would buy it. Also if there was a more expensive model with remote controls that I could use from my counter top, that would be ideal!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased second time after a few years. I had a cabinet built to house this when we remodeled and when it went out (light covers snapped, fan quit after screaming like bearings worn out) looked around and it would be a pain to get different brand because of the cabinet. So purchased another one and so far it doesn't look like components are different I hope it lasts longer than last one.
customer_reviews.author: JW Ideas

customer_reviews.title: Wiring is next to impossible
customer_reviews.text: If you want to lose your mind wiring a fan with wires about an inch long, this is the fan for you. I am not sure who works in a micro wiring environment like this but I didn’t expect or want to wire something with needle nose pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Kool-aide

customer_reviews.title: Noisy fan. Not balanced.
customer_reviews.text: This fan makes too much noise if speed is other than low. Seems out of balance. Do not like this product. Surprised the reviews are mostly positive. My fan is a disappointment with the noise and vibration. Moves a good amount of air on low but can't use medium or high. The fan didn't arrive damaged in any way, it's just a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: No one

customer_reviews.title: better motor , easy to replace , reduced cooking smell significantly
customer_reviews.text: this product matched what the original builder installed except for the motor speed. i recommend upgrading to this to get full power of the fan. the replacement takes is 30 min if you normally do some handy work in your home, recommend DIY. higher fan power will off course generate a bit more noice but reduced cooking smell significantly
customer_reviews.author: Nadeem Amin

customer_reviews.title: It's useful and sucks well
customer_reviews.text: The problem is that it is so noisy on any setting past the most basic. I wouldn't recommend this. If you have two pots of stew going or anything frying, you need a heavy duty suction that doesn't vibrate and roar. It vibrates so jarringly that it makes me literally cook less.
customer_reviews.author: Raindrops on Roses

customer_reviews.title: we bought this almost 2 years ago when we were ...
customer_reviews.text: we bought this almost 2 years ago when we were building our new house. we had to have this to put in our custom range hood. we have not had any problems out of it in over 2 years, so I would say that should speak volumes for this product
customer_reviews.author: murphy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t happen sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this!! I’ve been wanting to replace mine long enough and finally did! No regret doing so either!! The one that was here was from the previous home owner and wasn’t taken care of properly. Finally got it at a great price and I’m very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Artie

customer_reviews.title: Works way better than our cheap 100cfm fan
customer_reviews.text: This was desperately needed in our home we cook a lot and we sear and sautee and it has always filled our house with smoke because our cheap 100cfm fan couldn't keep up. This 390cfm unit was equal to our old unit on high when we put this one on low. When we put this on medium and high on this is much better. keeps the house from filling up with smoke. I was disappointed that I didn't read the "dimension fine print" on the separate mounting box i bought with this but the unit itself is great. It's loud on high and medium but it works well so it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT buy this exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: Spent hours trying to figure out why it was tripping my circuit breaker, turns out its the faulty wiring in the unit! NOT my electrician... NOT the new wire circuit he put in because of the problem... Its the cheap product that caused a full day of work and money to my electrician! Also, it doesn't come with bulbs and the sockets are NOT standard sized... good luck finding bulbs for that. I really hope Amazon gets rid of these scam sellers and cheap/dangerous products. I think we're all tired of getting ripped off!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Powerful cage fan with good controls and a light
customer_reviews.text: This unit is the exact size to replace a 1950's Saint Charles Kitchen Range Hood fan. The fan is powerful and has several speeds. There are two lights (40W refrigerator bulbs not included). I could not have asked for more
customer_reviews.author: Steve in New York

customer_reviews.title: Effective and right size.
customer_reviews.text: It really takes de smoke from my stove. I find the strongest speed more useful. Kind of noisy, but effective. The lights aren't too bright. Fitted perfectly inside an existing cabinet. No need to remodel the whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Joaflorida

customer_reviews.title: ... for something that wasn't expensive but still was a nice quality. My husband mad a wooden hood for ...
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something that wasn't expensive but still was a nice quality.My husband mad a wooden hood for the vent and it looks awesome. The installation of the vent was easy and it works realy good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built cheap, looks cheap
customer_reviews.text: Some items look better in person than their photos, this is the opposite. It’s just gray paint on flimsy sheet metal. It functions okay, but out of the box, the filter frame wouldn’t latch into place until I bent and re-shaped the outer housing. Disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.author: eric358

customer_reviews.title: The low option seems like it should be slightly faster
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but as other reviewers mentioned, it has basically two power settings, barely audible and jet engine. The low option seems like it should be slightly faster, not sure how effective it is but we tend to use that option more since the higher settings is soooo loud. But it is a very effective hood and was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tomasello

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love our vent! I was super excited to see that Joanna Gaines also used this one on a fixer upper she did! Works great too for being on the smaller side. A little loud, but it’s not bothersome to us!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DIY hood
customer_reviews.text: I custom made a vent hood, installed unit without the optional framing you can purchase. I also did not buy the exhaust kit. I got a few items from Lowe’s & did it myself. Low fan is very quiet. High fan is noisy, but no worse than any fan I’ve ever had. Easy to hook up & works great. 2 Candelabra bums installed, very bright. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for the area I needed it in
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for the area I needed it in. It could be a nicer unit but I'll still rate it five stars for the price. I do wish the low fan setting was a little faster and the high speed sounds like it could pull your toupé off!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: I really like this unit and may buy another one for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this unit and may buy another one for a backup before it is discontinued or if something goes wrong. Fact is replacement parts could far exceed the purchase price. Any way I wish it had stainless steel finish instead of the silver painted grid it comes with. The standard lights are to dim, I replaced with LED as recommended by other bloggers and it is great, not hot and much brighter.
customer_reviews.author: John Mako

customer_reviews.title: Does what it suppose to
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic 2 settings jet high and a low. Coloring little off More of a grey than stainless,but serves it’s purpose. Used with the insert and had it professionally installed since we have a custom type vent hood.
customer_reviews.author: David and Tanya

customer_reviews.title: I love this PM390 Range Hood insert
customer_reviews.text: My range is in a peninsula and needed to be drafted up through the cabinets above and out through the roof. After quite a bit of research found this one and am very happy with the purchase. It is not loud on high as some other reviewers have stated and sucks very well. I used LED lights as recommended for good light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this as it is only an insert to be covered by a good range.
customer_reviews.text: serves its purpose.....mine is not exposed so if your looking to have it exposed for an industrial feel, don't buy this as it is only an insert to be covered by a good range....i barely use mine but when I do its loud nothing that bothers me particularly. if you are looking for quiet....not the item. clears smoke at normal pace
customer_reviews.author: Giulz

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice
customer_reviews.text: This was a bit of a disappointment. Not bad, just not powerful as I had hoped. The fan blade is plastic, and the motor is very small. The unit vibrates on the high speed setting. Looks nice on the outside, cheaply made on the inside.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L

customer_reviews.title: Never worked out of box.
customer_reviews.text: Bought on Jan 23 of 2020. Had it Installed last week 4/30/2020 straight out of box in a new remodeled home. Light turns on and fan hums but it does not turn the blades. Contacted customer service, Will change review once contacted by customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Summer & Neal

customer_reviews.title: LOUD. Quite efficient but loud
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly loud. Wish I had listened to the other reviewer’s, I will be replacing it. It might not be so loud in a closed kitchen, mine is loud in an open concept kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Curley911

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: As described. We are barely using this unit for the fan, but we have been using the light. it was perfect for our needs. Slower fan is fine, i agree if you use the fan on high it is loud. Good price for what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dorota

customer_reviews.title: Works and fits perfectly, switches hard to find and reach.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my hood enclosure. I like it, and it was cheap, but the fan and light are annoying to access, especially when you actually need them (when you have hot smokey stuff on your grill and then have to awkwardly reach up to find the black (and thus impossible to see) switch). But, it works great, and is cheap, and was easy for my contractor to install.
customer_reviews.author: Arakashi

customer_reviews.title: This works slightly better than the old one
customer_reviews.text: This was a direct replacement for an older model from the late 80s. Unfortunately, I can't seem to find a slim unit. This works slightly better than the old one, but 250CFM is not enough to remove most cooking smoke. I seared a beef tenderloin and the smoke alarms went off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tsa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: It's installed correctly and doesn't have enough power to vent anything on the stove. Very disappointed! And it's so loud for no suction power.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal L.

customer_reviews.title: I think I made a good purchase on this
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace an old fan and light system in my home. I had to rig it onto an old custom-made system and it worked well (in my opinion). I have nothing to compare to, but I feel that the fan is powerful and not too loud. The lights are bright enough. Attractive looking system. I think I made a good purchase on this.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole R.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know it was bad until builder installed it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this vent hood as part of our remodel and only discovered it had a bad motherboard after installation. The fan works well but the lights don't work. We called Broan who sent out parts to fix it but the parts have to be soldered in. Another call later they sent a technician to fix it. Now we are waiting for the tech to come back with a soldering iron. It's a headache. Lesson learned about ordering this type of thing online.
customer_reviews.author: Legger

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: On the second time of turning on the fan, it shorted and won’t work. We had our electrician look at it and he said it was a faulty piece in the fan
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: This was built a little too cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I thought the price was suspiciously low, they just cut too many corners to hit the price point. Filter screen is a pain to remove, and install. 4 screws and two wire clips. Cheap and flimsy. It’s rated for T8 bulbs but they will not fit. I had to settle form sim little 15 watt bulbs. I would have gladly paid $ 10 or $20 more for better execution on the Design.
customer_reviews.author: Debera Van Nimwegen

customer_reviews.title: Installation a challenge because of height
customer_reviews.text: So, my exhaust opening in the side of the house was CUT long before cabinets and appliances were installed. So, when my guy tried to VENT this fan to the outside, he had to make a special metal vent box-- because the HEIGHT of my exhaust HOLE was too low. This fan, unlike many others, is tall so the actual connection to the outside is higher than most other models. Just check your specs to make sure it will work. I like the way it looks; I loved the price and the 390 CFM feature.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: good. Cooking space feel HUGE!
customer_reviews.text: It was a little hard to install but overall I love it! It is completely hidden under the cabinet which makes my cooking space feel much larger compared to my previous hood.
customer_reviews.author: Micah & Tami Stade

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this. My husband custom built our hood and this fan works. However, it came cracked and scratched. I realize its underneath but annoying to spend that much just to have it come damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Truth be told

customer_reviews.title: Don't usually review but we were pretty disappointed with this fan
customer_reviews.text: Don't usually review but we were pretty disappointed with this fan. It was powerful but very loud and controls looked and felt cheap. The lights were dim even after we got LED chandelier bulbs. Ended up with an under cabinet Broan that we liked MUCH better. Amazon was great about taking the return however.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Mandino

customer_reviews.title: Fan is loud. We purchased this in 2015 and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fan is loud. We purchased this in 2015 and have been living with it for years now. I avoid turning it on as much as I can. The fan works okay but it considering the noise you would think it is sucking up the vapors well. Not so much though. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great vent
customer_reviews.text: Great suction via a required six inch duct. Requires mounting hardware. It is loud on the high setting but has excellent suction. The low setting is quiet and also has good suction. Does include a duct baffle.
customer_reviews.author: C. B. Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Loud
customer_reviews.text: I love the price and that’s what ultimately led me to buy it. It works great but it’s super loud. I can’t hear people talking to me if I’m cooking. I do regret not paying more for a quieter one.
customer_reviews.author: Christy_AST

customer_reviews.title: A very powerful vent fan that is not for those who want a quiet one.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast! It is not quiet by any means, but it sure moves a lot of air! We cook a lot at home, and we really like it. The lights could be a little brighter, but the main thing we wanted was a lot of air removal, and it does that. We have used it almost daily for about two years, and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Custom at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my custom range hood. Great price and easy to install. Make sure you purchase the Hood liner and recirculating kit (if needed). Most importantly the hood liner is not included and needs to be purchased separately. It is a metal sheet designed to fit around the power pack for a clean look.
customer_reviews.author: KW&EF

customer_reviews.title: Light and Fan- Depends on your preference
customer_reviews.text: Looks great! Light is really bright- much more than my old incandescent light. Could be too bright for some people. See pics. Low speed fan is quiet but doesn’t really seem to do much. Hi fan speed is noisier than I’d hoped but works. Almost has a hum moan when on high.
customer_reviews.author: RMADFW

customer_reviews.title: It's decent
customer_reviews.text: Fairly powerful. Works decent. Light only has one setting, we had two on our old one and I preferred that. This is LOUD. Especially when on the 3rd setting. Jet engine style. Can't hear anyone, annoying loud. It's even sort of loud on the 1st setting. But maybe I'm just complaining about something that can't be changed.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Looks so much better than the old one and much quieter! The light is brighter than the old one also.
customer_reviews.author: tgray

customer_reviews.title: one failed within 6 mo. Amazon replaced at no cost to me
customer_reviews.text: One blower motor failed within 6 mo. The next one has lasted about 2 or 3 years. I've had to disassemble it to clean the grease out of the plastic fan which is a real pain. It doesn't have a very good grease collection system... then again most of these home fume hoods don't. (i made a custom housing for it to fit in between my cabinets)
customer_reviews.author: mike jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality fan, pretty quiet. Looks good in kitchen. Wished the paint was more stainless looking than grey. Good fit in 30 inch fan opening.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and works great!
customer_reviews.text: My custom cabinet company built my hood to accommodate another insert that was $1500. My contractor suggested I buy this instead and that we could adapt it to my custom hood. It turned out great and it is soooo quiet! Glad I didn't go with the overpriced other option!
customer_reviews.author: Dani Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Better than previous one!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and better than the one that we had installed when we built our house 10 years ago! I think the subcontractor we used must have left out some parts...this is an excellent product and quiet!
customer_reviews.author: TBurch

customer_reviews.title: Bad light issues
customer_reviews.text: I have used several of these fans on new homes. I have been pleased with everything except the issue with the light assembly. Regular candelabra bulbs are loose and don't fit in the receptacle tightly. After one month the light stopped working. Wiring is fine but cant get the light to work. Now I'm stuck with $100 fan that lasted for one month. I've had similar issues with other units.
customer_reviews.author: Miller Property Development

customer_reviews.title: Too loud.
customer_reviews.text: Ineffective. Too loud. Vented to outside and still doesn’t work well. Just makes a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Henny Penny

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement
customer_reviews.text: Replaced existing fan so was not same size but adjusting opening not a problem with new hood liner. Impressed by fan speeds, exhaustion, lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Donald W. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Good but takes weird bulb shape
customer_reviews.text: It’s fine overall but it doesn’t include bulbs and doesn’t take regular appliance bulbs (needs candela shapes bulbs) which kinda pissed me off.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Works.  Sounds like a jet taking off.
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace ours. This one still sounds like a flipping jet engine. If you want to watch TV while it's on, good luck. It saves you money to buy the part here on Amazon and then have it installed.
customer_reviews.author: Brasspiano

customer_reviews.title: Does the deed!
customer_reviews.text: This is handling pretty well. Cooking pretty much 5 days a week and oven use. It's pretty strong, clears the air great. I have a pretty serious range and I'm very happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Lubella

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very easy and straight forward. Been using since purchased with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca S.

customer_reviews.title: Unrealiable
customer_reviews.text: Now purchasing 3rd one in five years. The motor/blower assembly becomes unreliable after 2 years, very loud and appears multiple parts are loose. I’m only purchasing again because it cost more to reframe the hood.
customer_reviews.author: TomKat

customer_reviews.title: Received much anticipated system to complete a kitchen project now ...
customer_reviews.text: Received much anticipated system to complete a kitchen project now delayed because of the following: "390 CFM and 6 sones. The choice of 6 inch round duct (includes damper and adapter) or non-ducted discharge allow you to make the right installation decision for your home One-piece washable aluminum mesh filter", DID NOT INCLUDED THE DAMPER AND ADAPTER. What a boomer. Now i have to go to the trouble of getting it or returning the item so I can buy something local to continue my project.
customer_reviews.author: Quickshot210

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! The high setting is very loud, but very powerful. The low setting is not loud, but is still pretty powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Bailey

customer_reviews.title: used for 5 years, works ok, but face get rusted
customer_reviews.text: have one for 5 years, the motor still works fine, but panel get rusted and paint peels off, will look for stainless for my next one
customer_reviews.author: Zhou Zhiliang

customer_reviews.title: I wish the switches were a little better. They are a bit hard to activate when ...
customer_reviews.text: I inserted this in a 36" hood insert. I wish the switches were a little better. They are a bit hard to activate when you have to reach where you can't see. Would have been better to have rocker switches.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Steinhart

customer_reviews.title: Works but work area dimly lit
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The selection of light bulbs is limited. Would like brighter lighting.
customer_reviews.author: C. Steven Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Need to return and could not find another way to communicate.
customer_reviews.text: We are in the middle of a complete remodel of our kitchen. I bought this product ahead of the demo/install process. Our cabinets were recently installed on Oct 29. The hood would not fit and this is part of the hood. We were not able to control the install date and would appreciate consideration to return this item . Thank you in advance. Jill leon
customer_reviews.author: Jill Leon

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old unit in a hood over a range island in the middle of the kitchen. This unit barely fit in the space available and required some tough cutting to get it in. But it worked. It's simple and sturdy and gives better light than the old one and moves more air with less noise.
customer_reviews.author: R. Riggins

customer_reviews.title: No comments!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn’t useful for us and we returned the fan!
customer_reviews.author: Claude Dube

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in our kitchen, installation isn't difficult, ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well in our kitchen, installation isn't difficult, it seems to be missing some parts. Another issue that I have is that when you turn it off, you can hear the flap closing.Otherwise the pricing is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Alexis A.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I like this fan. It's not silent, but I wasn't expecting that given the power it has. Ours doesn't sit directly over the stove top since it's only in an 18 inch cabinet (which took some modification to get it in), but it still has enough power to suck up fumes. I think it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Recomended by the cabinet maker. We're very pleased with it. It's great for an average sized kitchen. If you have a very large kitchen cooktop you will need to go with something larger. Our gas stove top is 36 inch wide.
customer_reviews.author: mopar

customer_reviews.title: was good
customer_reviews.text: Range insert is great. I am still using it 4 years later. Very easy ti install and keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: Carpenter recommended this product for our new home. We are real happy with way it is mounted above the stove. Used two 60 watt LED bulbs that are really bright, don’t put off any heat.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Russell

customer_reviews.title: HELP!  Light unit will not work.
customer_reviews.text: The lighting function does not work and I cannot get support from Bron because they are telling me that Amazon has to initiate the inquiry. I am at a loss over the poor service I am receiving. I want the lighting unit replaced and no one will assist me.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, moves lots of air and pretty quiet
customer_reviews.text: Definitely moves a lot of air, not that loud. I wish the quality of the switches and what you cna see would be a little better, but good for the price I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Strong suction power
customer_reviews.text: This little thing packs a punch. Suction power is awesome but it does make noise as I suspect any fan would
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Great product for what it is designed
customer_reviews.text: was a perfect fit for a renovation that the wood cabinet part was still good and we wanted to reuse. It vents just fine as to what other people have said about it, I am not sure why they said what they did, but this works very well. Just one thing I wish Amazon would do, is to suggest the bulbs that would be needed and have them pop up for purchase as well. All in All would this again a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: denis j white

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, quiet (in low), easy install. Built a cedar vent hood and installed this vent. Works great. Was able to install with only the help from my sidekick. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It’s awesome for the money and pulls a lot of air
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a kitchen remodel.
customer_reviews.text: OMG is this thing quiet! I can actually hold a conversation while it is on. It has great suction power also. I had the over the stove microwave and hated it! When we were doing the design for the new kitchen this was a must have. I was so tired of smelling my food afterwards. No longer this is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to install and works well
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install and works well. I just mounted it directly to my ceiling over an island and it worked very well. Best of all, it's about $1000 cheaper than the alternatives and looks just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Instructions lacking in box
customer_reviews.text: no instructions in box, have to get them online from web-sight even then no very easy to install building contractor had problem with instructions as well
customer_reviews.author: King Korn

customer_reviews.title: Low speed is too low and high speed is TOO loud!
customer_reviews.text: have the same fan on the one we replace this one seems to hardly run on low speed setting, and is way too loud on high seting to stay in kitchen, will be finding a different one that operates correctly without the loud noise
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pinkham

customer_reviews.title: Good power, inexpensive, may squeak, broke after 3 years of use.
customer_reviews.text: the pros: powerful and relatively cheap. the cons: The unit started squeaking loudly at about 1 year of household use. I took it apart and lubricated the bearings (a pretty big job). The squeaking went away for a few months and then returned. Now, after 3 years of use, the motor binds up on the 1st speed setting. No more squeaking, no more suction, no more warranty. Unfortunately, I will probably buy another one of these as it would be expensive to make another unit fit. I will buy a warranty this time and request replacement as soon as it starts squeaking.
customer_reviews.author: DrewK

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Installed very easily in a new cabinet installation with Broan T-Shaped Hood Liner. Powerful suction and looks great!
customer_reviews.author: Jewelzazner

customer_reviews.title: Came with missing parts and scratches
customer_reviews.text: Came with missing parts (spring clips to retain unit in cabinet during installation). Per Amazon customer rep, should be new - not so sure, unit had scratches on it too... Amazon is replacing unit, however, messes up my scheduling with the cabinet installed... Disappointed. Should not have missing parts (however small it may be), and shouldn't have scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Murat

customer_reviews.title: Love that it is hidden in my
customer_reviews.text: Powerful fan! Using only as recirculator, not vented outside. Love that it is hidden in my cabinet
customer_reviews.author: Apples

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made, missing essential components
customer_reviews.text: Lot of quality compromises made by the manufacturer. Motor, plastic fan and aluminium body are pretty flimsy. Didn't even come with a wired plug or two bulbs, without which the appliance is incomplete. This was intended to be an exact replacement of builder installed fan that failed in 3.5 yrs. Some insulation tape would have been nice. Guess the manufacturer is not aiming for customer satisfaction. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Neha Jain

customer_reviews.title: poor warranty
customer_reviews.text: size was perfect fit for replacement..it replaced the same model that shorted out after 2 years . hassle on warranty
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: t moves a good amount of air for the given noise level but the cover and controls are cheap
customer_reviews.text: The fan and housing look like good quality materials but the cover and controls are cheap and i'm concerned about their longevity. For example, the sockets that the lights screw into are plastic instead of metal. it moves a good amount of air for the given noise level.
customer_reviews.author: kellie w

customer_reviews.title: Good blower. I own a cabinet company and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Good blower. I own a cabinet company and I order these for my customers when we are building a decorative hood. I have not had any complaints yet.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Worrell

customer_reviews.title: No problems after a year .
customer_reviews.text: This insert allowed me to build my own vent hood for my stove. I have been using it for a year now without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher

product_meta.title: Broan Aluminum Power Pack Range Hood Insert, Exhaust Fan and Light Combo for Over Kitchen Stove, Silver, 8.0 Sones, 250 CFM
product_meta.description:
Color:Aluminum| Style:250 CFMUpgrade your kitchen with the Broan Power Pack Range Hood Insert! This versatile insert is the perfect solution to your ventilation needs serving as both an exhaust fan and overhead light for your stove. The powder-coated silver unit is designed to fit neatly into your wall and fit flush with the bottom of your cabinets. It features a two-speed control to provide a quiet, effective performance and incandescent lighting that complements the beauty of a fully enclosed bottom containing dishwasher-safe filters to make cleaning easy. This hood insert includes a centrifugal blower for 250 CFM and 8. 0 Sones to provide an effective performance. The choice of 7 inch round duct (includes damper and adapter) or non-ducted discharge allow you to make the right installation decision for your home. It's designed with smooth surfaces that clean easily and quick-release filters that can go in the dishwasher. Enhance your home today with the Broan Power Pack Range Hood Insert!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
High-performance ventilation solutions. These integrated units provide the ventilation and lighting you need for your custom application.
feature_bullets: HIGH-QUALITY HOOD INSERT: Hood insert improves ventilation and lighting over your stove with the three-speed slide controls that provide 250 CFM of exhaust at 8. 0 Sones for a reliable performance each use
EFFECTIVE LIGHTING: The enclosed lighting area is home to dual incandescent 40-watt candelabra bulbs (sold separately)
EASY CARE: One-piece, washable aluminum mesh filter means you can maintain optimum grease capture and keep the kitchen fresh
QUICK CLEAN: Smooth surfaces clean easily and quick-release filters are dishwasher-safe, lessening your time spent in the kitchen
VERSATILE: Can work in an ADA Compliant situation when wired to operate from a dedicated, standard 2-rocker or 3-rocker wall switch to turn the hood on or off
Recommended for use with Models LB30, LB36, LT30 and LT36 Liners
Two-speed motor, 6-5/8-Inch Fan, 250 CFM, 8.0 Sones, 7-Inch round duct or non-ducted discharge, Enclosed light
Accepts two incandescent maximum 40-watt candelabra bulbs-Bulbs not included
One-piece, washable aluminum mesh filter-optional, disposable charcoal filter kit- #B08999040
Durable, powder coated silver finish, Fully enclosed bottom
